Detailed Description

Typedef Documentation

typedef int32_t(* UartSci_closeDMAFxn) (UartSci_Driver *ptrUartSciDriver)

This is the function prototype which is used by the UART driver to close the DMA services.

Parameters
[in]ptrUartSciDriverPointer to the UART Driver MCB
[in]ptrHwCfgPointer to the UART Driver Hardware configuration
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0
typedef struct UartSci_Driver_t UartSci_Driver

SCI Driver Master Control Block.

The structure is used to hold all the pertinent information with respect to the UART Driver.

typedef enum UartSci_DriverStatus_e UartSci_DriverStatus

UART SCI Driver Status.

The enumeration describes the status of the UART Driver Instance

typedef enum UartSci_Duplexity_e UartSci_Duplexity

UART SCI Driver Duplexity capability.

The enumeration describes the duplexity capabilities of the UART SCI Driver

typedef int32_t(* UartSci_initiateRxDMAFxn) (UartSci_Driver *ptrUartSciDriver, uint32_t dstAddress, uint32_t numBytes, bool pollingMode)

This is the function prototype which is used by the UART driver to initiate the receive DMA.

Parameters
[in]ptrUartSciDriverPointer to the UART Driver MCB
[in]dstAddressDestination address where the data is placed after it is received by the UART driver.
[in]numBytesNumber of bytes to be transmitted
[in]pollingModeSet to true to indicate that we need to poll for completion else set to false
Return values
Notapplicable
typedef int32_t(* UartSci_initiateTxDMAFxn) (UartSci_Driver *ptrUartSciDriver, uint32_t srcAddress, uint32_t numBytes, bool pollingMode)

This is the function prototype which is used by the UART driver to initiate the transmit DMA.

Parameters
[in]ptrUartSciDriverPointer to the UART Driver MCB
[in]srcAddressSource address of the buffer which is to be transmitted
[in]numBytesNumber of bytes to be transmitted
[in]pollingModeSet to true to indicate that we need to poll for completion else set to false
Return values
Success- 0
ErrorCode - <0
typedef bool(* UartSci_isDMAEnabledFxn) (UartSci_Driver *ptrUartSciDriver)

This is the function prototype which is used by the UART driver to check if the DMA services are available.

Parameters
[in]ptrUartSciDriverPointer to the UART Driver MCB
Return values
true- DMA Services are available
false- DMA Services are not available
typedef int32_t(* UartSci_openDMAFxn) (UartSci_Driver *ptrUartSciDriver, UartSci_HwCfg *ptrHwCfg)

This is the function prototype which is used by the UART driver to open and setup the DMA services.

Parameters
[in]ptrUartSciDriverPointer to the UART Driver MCB
[in]ptrHwCfgPointer to the UART Driver Hardware configuration
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0
typedef enum UartSci_PinMux_e UartSci_PinMux

UART SCI Driver PIN MUX.

The enumeration describes if the UART Instance requires to be PIN muxed.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum UartSci_DriverStatus_e

UART SCI Driver Status.

The enumeration describes the status of the UART Driver Instance

Enumerator
UartSci_DriverStatus_UNINITIALIZED 

Driver is uninitialized.

UartSci_DriverStatus_OPERATIONAL 

Driver is operational.

enum UartSci_Duplexity_e

UART SCI Driver Duplexity capability.

The enumeration describes the duplexity capabilities of the UART SCI Driver

Enumerator
UartSci_Duplexity_FULL 

Driver is capable of sending/receiving data.

UartSci_Duplexity_TX_ONLY 

Driver is only capable of sending data.

enum UartSci_PinMux_e

UART SCI Driver PIN MUX.

The enumeration describes if the UART Instance requires to be PIN muxed.

Enumerator
UartSci_PinMux_REQUIRED 

The UART Instance needs to be PIN MUXED OUT.

UartSci_PinMux_NOT_REQUIRED 

The UART Instance does not require PIN MUX.

Function Documentation

void UartSci_disableRxDMA ( volatile SCIRegs *  ptrSCIRegs)

Description
Utility function which is used to disable the receive DMA functionality for the specific SCI Instance

Parameters
[in]ptrSCIRegsPointer to the SCI Base
Return values
Notapplicable
void UartSci_disableTxDMA ( volatile SCIRegs *  ptrSCIRegs)

Description
Utility function which is used to disable the transmit DMA functionality for the specific SCI Instance

Parameters
[in]ptrSCIRegsPointer to the SCI Base
Return values
Notapplicable

Parameters

Return values
Notapplicable

Return values

int32_t UartSci_noDMAClose ( UartSci_Driver *  ptrUartSciDriver)

Description
The function is used to close the no DMA interface layer.

Parameters
[in]ptrUartSciDriverPointer to the UART driver for which the DMA is being closed
Return values
Success- Always return 0
int32_t UartSci_noDMAInitiateRxDMA ( UartSci_Driver *  ptrUartSciDriver,
uint32_t  dstAddress,
uint32_t  numBytes,
bool  pollingMode 
)

Description
The function is used to initiate the receive DMA. For the No DMA this should never be invoked and is a stub error catching function.

Parameters
[in]ptrUartSciDriverPointer to the UART Driver Instance
[in]dstAddressDestination address of the buffer where the data is to be placed
[in]numBytesNumber of bytes to be transmitted
[in]pollingModeSet to true to indicate that we need to poll for completion else set to false
Return values
Success- 0
ErrorCode - <0
int32_t UartSci_noDMAInitiateTxDMA ( UartSci_Driver *  ptrUartSciDriver,
uint32_t  srcAddress,
uint32_t  numBytes,
bool  pollingMode 
)

Description
The function is used to initiate the transmit DMA. For the No DMA this should never be invoked and is a stub error catching function.

Parameters
[in]ptrUartSciDriverPointer to the UART Driver Instance
[in]srcAddressSource address of the buffer which is to be transmitted
[in]numBytesNumber of bytes to be transmitted
[in]pollingModeSet to true to indicate that we need to poll for completion else set to false
Return values
Success- 0
ErrorCode - <0
bool UartSci_noDMAIsDMAEnabled ( UartSci_Driver *  ptrUartSciDriver)

Description
The function returns the status of the DMA configuration.

Parameters
[in]ptrUartSciDriverPointer to the UART Driver Instance
Return values
false- DMA Services are always disabled
int32_t UartSci_noDMAOpen ( UartSci_Driver *  ptrUartSciDriver,
UartSci_HwCfg *  ptrHwCfg 
)

Description
The function is used to open the No-DMA. This is a stub function which always succeeds.

Parameters
[in]ptrUartSciDriverPointer to the UART SCI Driver
[in]ptrHwCfgPointer to the UART SCI Hardware configuration
Return values
Success- Always return 0
